ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: MULTICHECKER

Two massive hearths evenly roast cheerful groups of magi, basting them in thick swaths of sweat. A far cry from the chilled austerity of the halls or the Mathetia, laughter and jocularity seem to permeate the room, emanating from the myriad groups like steam from a duck on the spit. If ever there were a serious conversation had here, it would be as out of place as Biracul in a brothel.

Frigid bones quickly thawing, Ormenos looks around for a place to rest. Though Ormenos looks only half-heartedly, as nary a chair would be empty at this time of day. Months' worth of fatigue hits his weary Falseflesh all at once, buckling his knees. A hand reaches for the door frame to stabilize the crumbling mage. Resigned laughter weakly leaves his lips no louder than dying whispers. Unintentionally he loses the reins to his Falseflesh and unintentionally he regains them. Nothing is within his control.

Ever since being assigned to the Wayfarer, the Inquisitor has been a man obsessed, intent on being the one to succeed where so many other Thought-Weavers had failed. Yet despite his recent success, he has come to understand just how little his intent matters. Anxiety's shadow hangs over him, as it always has, completely blocking out the light of Awareness. Unknown terrors lurk within the perpetual night, waiting to claim Ormenos' little remaining sanity.

However, Discipline yet casts its artificial glow, bestowing a momentary reprieve from the dangers of that sightless scene. That meager, though sufficient, orb of light wards of the ever-encroaching shades of Ignorance...
But for how long?

Raucous laughter wakens him from his nightmarish fugue, and the Calefactory's jolly atmosphere dispels the unknown terrors. Now warmed by the fires, Ormenos surveys the myriad hexagonal tables, expertly yet simply carved, spotting the floor. As expected, no seats remain unfilled.

But just as he is about to leave, a mage gets up at the far end of the room, freeing up a space. Opposite the man is the Inquisitor's young apprentice and fellow Jeran, Brother Mind Seer, feverishly penning his latest musings in the notebook he always seems to have at his side. This obsessiveness with details has always hindered the Mind Seer's ability to spot the tiger for wont of fixating on its stripes.

B.response_text: Leave the Calefactory

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: Determination seeps into the hesitant lines creasing the Mind Seer's brow. He rises, politely bows his head in deference to his mentor, and makes for the underhalls. As the only two Jerans in the Order, Ormenos has always felt a bond with the Mind Seer otherwise absent in his interactions with the Brothers and Sisters of the Enclave. Like caring for a real brother - or, given their age dissimilarity, a son, perhaps.

But soon this thought decays into just another banished memory. Other more pressing concerns return to occupy Ormenos' attention, and as his fatigue has somewhat subsided, he no longer sees anything to keep him in the Calefactory.
Thus, his feet swing in the direction of...

B.response_text: The Refectory

C.response_text: The Third Sphere of the underhalls

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: Two massive hearths evenly roast cheerful groups of magi, basting them in thick swaths of sweat. A far cry from the chilled austerity of the halls or the Mathetia, laughter and jocularity seem to permeate the room, emanating from the myriad groups like steam from a duck on the spit. If ever there were a serious conversation had here, it would be as out of place as Biracul in a brothel.

Frigid bones quickly thawing, Ormenos looks around for a place to rest. Though Ormenos looks only half-heartedly, as nary a chair would be empty at this time of day. Months' worth of fatigue hits his weary Falseflesh all at once, buckling his knees. A hand reaches for the door frame to stabilize the crumbling mage. Resigned laughter weakly leaves his lips no louder than dying whispers. Unintentionally he loses the reins to his Falseflesh and unintentionally he regains them. Nothing is within his control.

Ever since being assigned to the Wayfarer, the Inquisitor has been a man obsessed, intent on being the one to succeed where so many other Thought-Weavers had failed. Yet despite his recent success, he has come to understand just how little his intent matters. Anxiety's shadow hangs over him, as it always has, completely blocking out the light of Awareness. Unknown terrors lurk within the perpetual night, waiting to claim Ormenos' little remaining sanity.

However, Discipline yet casts its artificial glow, bestowing a momentary reprieve from the dangers of that sightless scene. That meager, though sufficient, orb of light wards of the ever-encroaching shades of Ignorance...
But for how long?

Raucous laughter wakens him from his nightmarish fugue, and the Calefactory's jolly atmosphere dispels the unknown terrors. Now warmed by the fires, Ormenos surveys the myriad hexagonal tables, expertly yet simply carved, spotting the floor. As expected, no seats remain unfilled.

As he turns to leave, hints of whispers reach his ears, the serious tone a stark contrast to the levity that surrounds it. He listens closely, but not too intently, lest he meet the mantis' fate in its pursuit of prey. Indeed, he recalls the Phrygian admonitions on being too absorbed in a task. Proof positive is that all magi here congregated were utterly unaware of this errant group due to a devout pursuit of frivolity. No, Ormenos did not want to hunt only to then become the hunted. But if he is careful, perhaps he can pluck the prize without first tripping the wire...

B.response_text: Wisely leave the Calefactory

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: The Enforcers immediately rise and scatter to the six directions, never even glancing at Ormenos. Their cabal undetected, unseen, unprecedented now weighs heavy on the Inquisitor's mind. The world seems ever-eager to provide him with enough rope to hang himself with.

Warmth banishes the chill hiding in Ormenos' bones. So subtly did the wintry halls rob him of heat that he barely even noticed. Only now in the presence of warmth does he realize just how little heat remained within him. The Inquisitor had often thought this of Time, but only now does he connect the two events, wondering what other resource of his now slowly - nay, imperceptibly - diminishes beyond his awareness...
A somewhat useless musing, he concludes, as it will merely serve to feed the already raging flame of his anxiety. Better to let such things lurk in the shadow of ignorance.

But the Inquisitor knows his nature, if nothing else. He is only ever interested in the shadows cast by the light of Awareness; to him, that is the true meaning of Discipline - to witness, to grasp that which not even Awareness can know...

Suddenly, the spark of recognition calls his attention back from the nether regions of thought. Before him stands the Beast Lord, a particularly savage moniker for such a learned man - typical of Enforcer Falsenames, though.

Eyes lock. Confusion from one, mirrored by the other. But then his Brother's reason for being here dawns on him. Epiphanies of this sort are what the Inquisitor lives for. Awareness birthed from Ignorance, the ecstatic bliss of sudden realization. Though short-lived it is, for the Beast Lord is here to herald this Inquisitor's end...
Feet shuffle, directed by the strings of foreign wills, toward the Nave, toward Ormenos' reckoning...

Embers fade to ash, the dying breaths of the Calefactory's two great fires. The moon has risen and all magi should be in their quarters. Should be. Yet, crystalline lanterns carve light from the shadows, revealing a sizable crowd, all of the Enforcer caste given their cloaks. Where there should be none, dozens congregate. This breach of protocol is just another mystery tickling the Inquisitor's greatest weakness: his curiosity.

Atop a table at room's center, an unexpected orator addresses the gathering. The Jinn Slayer. Condemned to the Vault for his arrogant outburst towards the Choir, and yet somehow absent from his new prison. Questions roiled through the Inquisitor's racing mind. Some answers he likely knows, others are genuine mysteries, ripe for the unraveling.

Transfixed by thoughts and theories, by whys and hows, Ormenos forgets to listen. A thundering cheer then reminds him. The raucous choir calls the Inquisitor back to the Falseflesh, and the Jinn Slayer's words finally penetrate perception.

The roused crowd responds with a unison clamor of affirmations and nonsensical celebratory hoots. These, the greatest minds of the era, have devolved into an unsophisticated and ambiguous entity, into an unthinking and indivisible unit, into a mere mob.

Suddenly, a sharp flicker of reflected light steals the Inquisitor's attention. Shimmering orbs, slick, moist, darker than black on red-veined pearls. These glassy curves play host to the ghostly twins of the chamber's myriad lamps.

Eyes. Penetrating, dangerous eyes. Ones that see only what they want; ones that stare until all becomes as it sees them. The Jinn Slayer has stayed his tongued, and silence has descended upon his flock as they search for the object of his interest, for the one who now steals his vision.

Ormenos apprehensively compels his feet toward the center of the crowd. The Jinn Slayer descends from his makeshift dais, slapping a friendly hand upon the reticent mage's shoulder. Firmly he grips; passionately he speaks, words pouring forth like fire from a roused volcano.

Dozens of voices roar the proper reply: "For the future of Humanity!" Even Ormenos finds himself silently mouthing the words, as of habit. Brother Jinn Slayer strides towards the exit, leading his mob out of the Calefactory and towards their ultimate act of defiance against the Choir of Archons.

Ormenos is left to contemplate the implications of these actions - for regardless of the outcome, the Order of the Enclave as he knows it ends tonight. If the Jinn Slayer prevails, he replaces the Choir. And if he fails, he and his dozens of followers will face indefinite detention in the Vault...

And though tainted with zealous phrasing, the Jinn Slayer spoke no lies. Brother Entropy Stayer will take over Ormenos' duties at the Choir's behest. Ormenos will not travel to Kabu to find the Thought Wheel of the Beginning - his long-sought prize. He will not discover the secrets of the Vanquished ruins. Nor will he ever be recognized for these achievements, not even as the catalyst for them.

No, in fact, he is more alone than ever, caught in the shadow of some gargantuan mind, some greater entity formed from the will of the many magi of the Enclave. Crushed by the oppressive weight of the majority, he has little choice. His future is uncertain, nebulous...
Terrifying.

Silent resignation overcomes him as he sinks his face into his hands. Feeble lamentations douse his ruinous grin - for the absurdity of a helpless individual drowning in the sea of communal will now amuses and frightens in equal measure.
Yet, as is often the case in the tumultuous reality Ormenos inhabits, his mental woes give way to more pressing woes of the Falseflesh...

A cataclysmic rumble makes jelly of his muscles. He stumbles then tumbles, sending him crashing down to the floor. The quaking prevents pain, prevents sensations altogether, as though overloading perception with too many changes crammed into the space of a thought. Stone cracks and wood splinters, yet the support beams hold. Dust rains down from the ceiling, but nothing else. Suddenly...
The shaking subsides. Breath quickens. Heart races. But beyond that, only silence rings.

Shivers course through the mage's tensing musculature, in imitation of the recent quake. His nerves are candlewicks fried and frayed beyond repair; unable to sustain prolonged mimicry, the shaking soon abates. The exhausted Inquisitor now lies motionless on the ground, soaking in the post-traumatic peace. Another disaster survived; another crisis averted.
Until a second jolt loosens the stone from the rafters and rains detritus down upon the frightened mage.

Panicked, instincts assume command. Ormenos rolls under the nearest table, avoiding the worst of the stony hail. When it stops, he runs for the exit, sensing it won't be long before the entire structure collapses.
Thus ends the Enclave...
"Brother Inquisitor, I've been dispatched to escort you to the Nave. Your truancy has not gone... unnoticed..."
"...May I speak candidly with you, Brother?"

B.response_text: "I'd prefer if everyone were always candid."

D.response_text: "Unless it's to tell me I'm free to go, then no."

E.response_text: "Let's just go to the Nave and get it over with."

F.response_text: "NOW caveman want talkie-talk! But in Kabu only give cold shoulder!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "...What happened to you, Brother? When did ice replace fire in your words?"
"...A useless inquiry, I suppose. After all, there's no way to ask the snow how it grew cold..."
"All is ever as it should be."
"Brothers! Sisters! Members of the Enclave! Listen well!"
"Ormenos has been utterly negligent in his duties to us, his only family! Idling time away as though it grew on Muninns."
"But time is precious, ever-diminishing; its wasteful misuse is a crime of the highest order!"
"And so the Choir has summoned him, to stand before them, to bear the weight of their righteous judgment!"
"Seek not his path! Break all ties of kinship! - lest you follow him to the Vault..."
"For the good of the Order!"
"Gratitude, Brother."
"When I first came to the Order, you were already renowned and respected - perfection made flesh."
"You'd already accomplished more in your five year tenure than most magi do in a lifetime."
"And in the years since, I've witnessed you do everything the Choir demanded of you, always without complaint."
"I won't belabor the point, but you're clearly anything but a negligent member of the Order."
"So, why, Ormenos? Why have you forsaken your duties? Why throw it all away now?"

A.response_text: "Why does a delayed report matter so much to the Choir?"

B.response_text: "Because I have more important affairs to attend to."

E.response_text: "And why exactly must we respond to the crack of the Choir's whip?"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Candidness... Yes, I too wish everyone could just be candid."
"But it looks like we'll just have to settle for it between us two for now."
"What I wanted to say was that when I first came to the Order, you were already renowned and respected - perfection made flesh."
"You'd already accomplished more in your five year tenure than most magi do in a lifetime."
"And in the years since, I've witnessed you do everything the Choir demanded of you, always without complaint."
"I won't belabor the point, but you're clearly anything but a negligent member of the Order."
"So, why, Ormenos? Why have you forsaken your duties? Why throw it all away now?"

A.response_text: "Why does a delayed report matter so much to the Choir?"

B.response_text: "Because I have more important affairs to attend to."

C.response_text: "I don't chose my actions, Adarin; they're chosen for me."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "What I wish to say is that when I first came to the Order, you were already renowned and respected - perfection made flesh."
"You'd already accomplished more in your five year tenure than most magi do in a lifetime."
"And in the years since, I've witnessed you do everything the Choir demanded of you, always without complaint."
"I won't belabor the point, but you're clearly anything but a negligent member of the Order."
"So, why, Ormenos? Why have you forsaken your duties? Why throw it all away now?"

B.response_text: "Because I have more important affairs to attend to."

C.response_text: "I don't chose my actions, Adarin; they're chosen for me."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Caveman? Kabu? Brother, we first met after I came to the Enclave... And besides, you've never even been to my homeland..."

F.response_text: "How can I put this? You become a depressing, emo jerk in the future."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Regardless, it seems you've no intention of actually listening to a Brother's earnest words..."

F.response_text: "By Roostor's Comb! You misunderstand! You're destined to die alone in a cave!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Ormenos, the Choir has never tolerated acts of insubordination! What possessed you to believe this policy had somehow changed?!"

A.response_text: "I just don't think the Choir's will should take precedence to all others."

B.response_text: "Curiosity guides my action, not the Choir's will."

E.response_text: "It'll never change when supposed 'beasts' allow themselves to be collared..."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "What's of such supreme importance that you've staked your very life on it?!"

A.response_text: "I just don't think the Choir's will should take precedence to all others."

B.response_text: "Curiosity. It alone guides my action, not the Choir's will."

C.response_text: "Importance is a product of whim; nothing is 'supremely' important."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "I see my earnest concern is of little consequence to you."
"Ormenos, the Choir has never tolerated any acts of insubordination! What possessed you to believe this policy had somehow changed?!"

D.response_text: "It wasn't my choice! I was forced! Perhaps something to do with the Wayfarer!"

E.response_text: "It'll never change when supposed 'beasts' allow themselves to be collared..."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Ormenos, the Choir has never tolerated any acts of insubordination! What possessed you to believe this policy had somehow changed?!"

A.response_text: "And why should the Choir's will take precedence to all others?"

D.response_text: "It wasn't my choice! I was forced! Perhaps something to do with the Wayfarer!"

E.response_text: "It'll never change when supposed 'beasts' allow themselves to be tamed..."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "I've little tolerance for your disloyal musings, Brother..."
"The Choir's will IS our will! Ever has been and ever will be, too!"
"We crush our own desires for the good of the Order!"

B.response_text: "Letting others think for you is nothing but willful ignorance..."

E.response_text: "I reject the bonds of our enslavers!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "But we can reforge it in the fire of the mind, reshape it into its perfect form, into unity!"
"Though my argument clearly falls on deaf ears."
"Farewell, Brother. May the decay of your Falseflesh precede the decay of your sanity..."
"For the good of the Order."
"Then it's to the endless Void of the Graylands 'Curiosity' leads you, proud Inquisitor."
"It pains me to have seen your fall... Once a proud and loyal Brother, now to be nothing more than a forgotten memory."

A.response_text: "Your pain is meaningless without change, Brother."

B.response_text: "I regret nothing."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps it's for the best, for regret would profit you nothing at this point."
"From the cultivator we seek knowledge of crops; from the artisans we seek skill of crafts; likewise from the Choir we seek wisdom beyond individual biases."
"...From Thought-weaver to Thought-woven..."
"It pains me to have seen your fall... Once a proud and loyal Brother, now to be nothing more than a forgotten memory."

D.response_text: "Surely you could just say that I had 'escaped', Brother..."

E.response_text: "I reject the bonds of our enslavers!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "And now you grovel for your worthless Falseflesh?! Does betrayal of the Order demand reward, Ormenos!?"
"Certainly! We're just like tamed beasts! For aren't lowly beasts commanded to greater works by their betters?"

A.response_text: "Letting others think for you is nothing but willful ignorance..."

D.response_text: "Look, perhaps you could let your old friend 'accidentally' escape..."

E.response_text: "I reject the bonds of our enslavers!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Then you've gone the way of the Jinn Slayer..."
"You'll make fine bed fellows in the Vault."
"And so it begins, slavery's requiem!"
"Soon Brother Jinn Slayer will shatter the false mirror our puppet-masters cloak themselves behind!"
"Is not this blindness to riches, like all our ills, the Choir's fault?"
"Their hands were ever gripped around our neck, and us none the wiser, before the Jinn Slayer came to us..."
"And the future of Humanity!"
"Brothers! Sisters! Loyal siblings of the Enclave!"
"Tonight we exact revenge for the countless generations of Enclaveans deceived by the Sylvan Architect and his Choir of traitorous Kharr-spawn!"
"Those malevolent pawns of the Masters who made Vault-dwellers of countless innocent Brothers and Sisters!"
"Tonight we summon the twinned Masters, the enemies of the nefarious malefactor of our Order! The one thing the Architect fears!"
"Tonight the insidious Masters will be as fire and water! Obliterating each other upon contact!"
"Tonight! We achieve the dream of every Enclavean mage since the beginning!"
"We shatter the hidden chains of ignorance!"
"Tonight we finally become free!"
"Honest eyes reveal a Brother come late to our meeting..."
"Come! Join us in our victory over oppression!"
"Brother Inquisitor, chief among the Thought-Weavers as you are, you're well-aware of the frequent injustice meted out by the Choir."
"Why just this very evening, your contributions and achievements were ignored and you were relegated to inactivity at the hands of those Kharr-loving Archons, weren't you?"
"And wasn't Brother Entropy Stayer commanded to 'relieve' you of your task? The very one you toiled harder than any mage before you to achieve?"
"And this was the 'reward' for your success. So, tell me, Brother, doesn't this disturb you?"
"Do you not likewise seek to shuck their reins and be free, once and for all?"

E.response_text: "I doubt we'll be any freer under your reins."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Then all is as it should be!"
"Now, Enforcers! To the Stone Circle! Let's retake our Order from the pestilent hands of the Masters!"
"For the good of the Order!"
"Understandable, to be sure, Brother. But in time, you'll come to know..."
"You injure me, Brother!"
"I stand before you as Brother, not as Archon!"
"Equals in chains, and equals in freedom..."
"...and before the moon sets this eve, we shall all be equals unchained!"
"...Unwittingly, of course. Those fools argue endlessly over iron while sleeping on gold..."
"When we take the reins of the Order, I'll make sure to guide the Grove-dwellers toward more important discoveries..."
"Truth is yours, Brother. Though young and impulsive, Brother Jinn Slayer's moral compass never strays from true north."
"You speak with the wisdom of Discipline!"
"The Glyph etchings around the Stone Circle are my task..."
"Sister Oath Abettor, you should be among the Enforcers in the Nave when the Jinn Slayer confronts the Choir."
"And the future of Humanity!"
"As for you, Brother, make sure the Awakened find themselves here at moonrise; we march on ignorance and tyranny tonight!"
"For the good of the Order!"
"Brothers, I bear great news!"
"War upon the Choir comes before the moon rises in the east!"
"Not he, but Sister Form Forger of the Huginn Grove..."
"But let's not idly sit while tides shift!"
"We must make the preparations necessary to contain the Nameless watchers!"
"Trapped in the Falseflesh, we can best them!"
"But first, the summoning..."
"As you say, Brother."
"Those peddlers of Enclavean Trueflesh will settle for nothing less than Brother Jinn Slayer's permanent silence..."
"But no Vault-dweller is he! We'll make sure to bring him safely here when the moon rises."
"The Choir will sing only to themselves after tonight! For the good of the Order!"
"Wyrm's legs! Brother! You startled me!"

A.response_text: "Sorry, Brother; didn't mean to scare you."

B.response_text: "Not in the present... lost in thought, were you?"

D.response_text: "You're on edge, Brother... What mischief have you been causing?"

E.response_text: "As feeble-minded as ever, I see."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Don't apologize, Brother! It was my fault entirely - was too absorbed in my thoughts to notice your approach! How may I assist you?"

B.response_text: "Not absorbed; lost."

E.response_text: "I doubt you could assist me."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "In truth, I was - still am, actually - lost in Thought's Labyrinth; it makes the Path of Discipline seem trivial by comparison."
"I've been thinking a lot about our homeland, and how it often haunts my dreams, as of late..."

B.response_text: "Oh? Did you know Torma might've gone there to find the Mystics?"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "I shouldn't be so careless... If this had been the Palace of Memory, I might've lost my Self to another's whim."
"My fault entirely - was too caught in a web of thoughts to even notice your approach!"

B.response_text: "Untempered thought is an impossible maze; more likely you were 'lost' in thought than 'caught'."

D.response_text: "A web? Out with it then! What Hamlikan schemes were you devising...?"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Brother... your remarks as not as... gentle, as usual..."
"...Have I done something to offend you?"

A.response_text: "No. I'm just not myself, as of late. I'm really just here to talk."

D.response_text: "If you have to ask, then you must be unrepentant..."

E.response_text: "Your mere existence is offensive. Fix that."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Aaaaaaaaaaahhh!!"
"Why did you scream like that?! You scared me again and now we both look like fools!"

F.response_text: "Speak for yourself! I'm a freakin' Vanargand compared to your dumbass!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "To talk? What about, Brother?"

B.response_text: "About the Wayfarer."

E.response_text: "About the damned Choir of Arch-cons."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "My dreams? Oh, y'know, the usual nightmares that brought me here in the first place..."
"...Though, I've also started to dream of my Uncle... and the Mystics."

B.response_text: "Torma supposedly went to Jer - something to do with the Wyrm and the Mystics."

E.response_text: "Unremarkable. Such fitting dreams for a weak intellect."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Wait... You mean to say the Wayfarer might've had contact with the Mystics?! Were you diving for memories in Jer this last time?!"

B.response_text: "No, in Zhili. Haven't yet been to Jer with her - and might not get to either."

C.response_text: "Perhaps we can discuss this another time."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Oh... Of course. We really should be getting back to our tasks anyway."
"Indeed, I hear the Choir is anxiously awaiting your report! And though I know not what you saw, I can tell by your abrupt exit from the Mind-Loom that it's of great significance..."
"Best to hurry, Brother. The other day, I heard Sister Crystal Gazer was sentenced to the Vault for being only a few hours late with her report..."
"No Thought-weaver wants to see a Brother or Sister - especially one of our own caste - on the other side of a Mind-Loom. So, please get to the Nave quickly!"
"What?! No, Brother! You misjudge me! I craft no rusty schemes today!"
"I was just thinking of our homeland - and how it often haunts my dream, as of late..."

C.response_text: "Perhaps we can discuss this another time."

E.response_text: "It's odd that you think I care."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "I... I'm truly at a loss. But nonetheless, I never intended any offense! Especially to a fellow Jeran!"

D.response_text: "I'm ashamed to even call you a 'fellow' Jeran."

E.response_text: "Your mere existence is offensive. Fix that."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "...Truly, there is little I can offer a senior Thought-Weaver, as my experience pales in comparison. But I can offer the ears and heart of a fellow Jeran, if you ever need it, Brother."

A.response_text: "Should the need arise, I might deign to call on you."

D.response_text: "I'm ashamed to even call you a 'fellow' Jeran."

E.response_text: "Your mere existence is offensive. Fix that."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "...I did not realize this was how you felt, Brother..."
"I apologize for delaying your report to the Choir and will disturb you no more."

A.response_text: "Yes, perhaps I had best go report to the Choir."

D.response_text: "As long as you know your place, all is as it should be."

E.response_text: "The powerless delay nothing, Junior Thought-Weaver."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Yes, of course. Then I'll be at your service, Brother."
"Though, for now I'll delay you no longer, as I'm sure the Choir is more deserving of your company that a junior Thought-Weaver."
"...I am... confused? First screams, then insults. I hope that the burden of Thought-Weaving hasn't finally crumbled your sanity..."
"...Brother, may I speak candidly?"

B.response_text: "Actually, I think I should go."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Gratitude, Ormenos..."
"I hesitate to say this, even now that you and I'll never return to Jer, but I believe my Uncle was at one point a Mystic..."

B.response_text: "I suspected as much."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "You did? Leave it to the Inquisitor to see so plainly what us truth-blind pretenders cannot..."

"Well, after much thought, I've come to believe that his mental afflictions are likely a product of the bizarre rites and dark rituals in which they engaged, though I've never did find any conclusive evidence."
"However, among the many insane and incoherent phrases my Uncle uttered was one that always shocked and disturbed me..."
"'And clear is the path! For the Blood Pact between the Eidos and the Wyrm spells Thetian's name!' He'd repeat this over and over."
"In truth, one reason I left Jer was to escape the Mystics. I figured they'd never be able to touch me here..."

B.response_text: "Knowledge can be ugly, but the truth is always beautiful."

C.response_text: "Nothing lasts forever - both safety and danger."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "For now. But safety is illusory, a cruel appetizer for dread..."
"...Honestly, I've started to see the allure the Cults Morticarum hold..."
"There's only one path to a lasting safety..."
"...Perhaps I should replace my fragile safety with the truth's perils, swap ignorance for awareness..."
"Thank you, Brother. Your words have inspired me more than you could ever know..."
"Wait... Oh no! I've wasted so much of your time! I hope you're not late for your report to the Choir!"
"Quickly, Brother! Get to the Nave!"
"Me? I'm... fine, of course. Just been thinking of our homeland recently - and how it haunts my dreams as of late..."

B.response_text: "Our homeland? Torma supposedly went there to find the Mystics."

E.response_text: "I regret asking; what a waste of time."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "What of her, Brother? Is this about what happened earlier in the Vault?"

A.response_text: "Yes, I'm still wondering how she discovered my presence..."

B.response_text: "No, just found it odd that Torma supposedly went to Jer to find the Mystics."

C.response_text: "On second thought, perhaps I had best leave."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Oh, well, this is still of great interest, indeed... Thank you, Brother."
"Yes, of course... I'll delay you no longer, as I'm sure the Choir is more deserving of your company that a junior Thought-Weaver."
"My dreams..?"
"Well, most were about my Uncle..."
"Him... and the Wyrm of the Mystics."

C.response_text: "Torma supposedly went to Jer - something to do with the Wyrm."

D.response_text: "What interest do you have in the Mystics..?"

E.response_text: "I knew talking to you would be a waste of breath."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Sshhh! Brother! Reckless speech finds willing ears easily..."
"Others of our Order have been cast among the Vault-dwellers for lesser offenses that misspeech..."
"Best to keep any qualms about the Choir as they keep the Wayfarer: caged in the depths."

D.response_text: "So, you'd hide the truth behind a Hamlikan veil...?"

E.response_text: "Your cowardice is revolting."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "...The Choir are strict, but they're our leaders after all."
"In any event, I'll disturb you no longer, Brother."
"Brother! You misjudge me; I think only of your well-being!"
"Aaaaaaaaaaahhh!! Oh! Not again, Brother! I must leave before we are both thrown into the Vault! Farewell!"

F.response_text: "Did you know they removed the word 'buzz-killer' from the dictionary?"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "This is troublesome indeed... I wonder if the Archives might have any records on former investigators..."

A.response_text: "They do indeed. Perhaps I'll head there."

B.response_text: "I wonder if they have any information on her connection with the Mystics..."

E.response_text: "I knew talking to you'd be a waste of breath."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "Glad I could help! But, I think you should first visit the Nave, Brother."
"In truth? Why would they do such a thing?"

F.response_text: "Why? Well, to replace it with your picture of course!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!CALEFACTORY!.dialogue_text: "...Brother, you're uncharacteristically given to the chicane today..."
"I assume it has to do with the episode in the Mind-Loom, so I implore you! Please go visit the Nave with haste!"
"Only they can help you at this point."
MULTICHECKER

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!ORMENOS' CEL.dialogue_text: MULTICHECKER

The seamless stone wall marking Ormenos' door fades from reality, unveiling the path to his sleeping cell - his sanctuary, his only haven of absolute respite from the noisy spinning of cogs and their unending machinations. Here he can finally just be - no pretense, no interpreting the minds of others, no complex emotional labyrinths to traverse. This is true freedom.

As he steps into the room, the dark glass suspended upon the wall opens like a sleepy eye, filling the room with light. This Thiudan marvel is the proof of his station as a senior among magi, a token of his service to the Order. Ormenos need but conjure any scene from memory or imagination and upon its glassy surface will it be reflected. As a creature of habit, Ormenos tends err on the side of actuality rather than potentiality. The glass responds, displaying a constant flow of waves breaking near the barnacled piers of Jer. Though he may never again go there, at least his thoughts often find their way home.

B.response_text: Go lie down

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!ORMENOS' CEL.dialogue_text: Walking towards his resting cabinet, he first glances over at his most prized possession, locked away in its translucent display case. Within lies an illuminated copy of "The Art of Blindsight" by the tortured mage, Rikharr of Kabu. The tome utterly confused Ormenos in his youth, yet it spoke to him, like a long forgotten friend. As he first turned its final page, he vowed to become a mage to decipher its many mysteries.
But that passionate gallop of a young mind has devolved into the labored trot of a weary, old mage - moving more from inertia than inspiration.

B.response_text: Lie down and rest

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!ORMENOS' CEL.dialogue_text: Yet he seems to have read it so often that it is literally ingrained within his Trueflesh. Though the world be yet filled with mysteries, none seem to sway him anymore; new questions are merely old ones dressed in finer clothing - and still stubbornly resisting resolution. Thus, that passionate gallop of a young mind has devolved into the labored trot of a weary, old mage - moving more from inertia than inspiration.

B.response_text: Return to the Calefactory

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!ORMENOS' CEL.dialogue_text: Ormenos opens the case, and retrieves the text. Yellowed pages, worn thin at the corners from such frequent turning, have the musty cologne of an aged tome. He glances over the words he has consumed so many times prior. Words join into phrases of the conversation he never had, but always wanted to have, with the disgraced Rikharr.

A sense of hopelessness fills him as he feels the touch of the 'beast' so bitterly described. For once in his life, he feels a genuine understanding of the emotions which led to the rise of the Jinnwraith and the terrible actions he took to exterminate his people. Ormenos would want to do the same, but believes he would lack the gall to do it.
Now all he can do is curl up, knees to chest, calmly waiting to forget this gut-wrenching sensation.
But he cannot forget. His racing mind will not allow it.
And the cracking sound he now hears is the breaking of his sanity as it collapses under the weight of awareness.
Slowly, he sinks into a deep slumber...
Ormenos lays his head upon the pillow, eyelids likewise falling shut. Deeply he breathes, for if it is rest he seeks, for once his weary Falseflesh should oblige.
Yet try as he may, worry wards off sleep. Lying in bed, Ormenos quietly contemplates his history with the Wayfarer, invading her mind to steal her thoughts - and all to what end?

The Thought Wheel of the Beginning - if what the Thiuda believed is true - would propel all back into the golden era of the Vanquished. But if it were so easily found, how could Wulfias have missed it as he razed the Ataraxia to the ground? How could countless generations of magi have simply left the master craft of the Vanquished to be covered by the sands of Kabu?
If only he could go to see it for himself... Perhaps this could be the spark that would rekindle the fire of his mind...

But one thing is as true now as it ever was: he can do nothing from the comfort of his resting cabinet. Motionless, he cannot hope to push the boundaries of knowledge. And what right-minded person would call a 'mage' the indolent loaf who all day in his cell reposes?
So Ormenos swiftly rises to his feet, feeling lightheaded from the sudden movement, and rushes out of his room. With purpose, the reinvigorated mage sprints into action.

Directing his feet back whence they came, Ormenos moves to leave the comfort of his humble cell. The seamless stone wall once more turns to mist, fading into fiction; in sympathy, the light of his dark glass likewise fades to black as he departs.

The seamless stone wall marking Ormenos' door fades from reality, unveiling the path to his sleeping cell - his sanctuary, his only haven of absolute respite from the noisy spinning of cogs and their unending machinations. Here he can finally just be - no pretense, no interpreting the minds of others, no complex emotional labyrinths to traverse. This is true freedom.

As he steps into the room, the dark glass suspended upon the wall opens like a sleepy eye, filling the room with light. This Thiudan marvel is the proof of his station as a senior among magi, a token of his service to the Order. Ormenos need but conjure any scene from memory or imagination and upon its glassy surface will it be reflected. As a creature of habit, Ormenos tends err on the side of actuality rather than potentiality. The glass responds, displaying a constant flow of waves breaking near the barnacled piers of Jer. Though he may never again go there, at least his thoughts often find their way home.

Feet shamble to the bed, whereupon the Falseflesh the lies. All action is devoid of intent, merely habit-driven. Eyes stare at the ceiling, looking but not seeing. Fear. The Choir. Terror. The Choir. Control. The Choir...
The Choir...
It is the voice of the many, far more resonant than the voice of one. Their collective will made sound, their joined thought made word.
Though at the edge of his thoughts he wishes it were otherwise...
Rage surges. Rage at the Choir. Rage at his weakness. Rage at the crippling complacency with which he has conducted his affairs throughout his miserable life.
The rebel living at the edge of his thoughts vows that someday he will break free from the curse of fear and forge his own destiny...
But not today.
No, he yet lacks the strength of character necessary to do so. Perhaps the life he lives breeds weakness; perhaps a change can teach true strength.
Answers elude his malformed questions... thoughts grow hazy, refusing to sense make...
Sleep arrives.

Ormenos races through the Calefactory and into the sleeping quarters, rushing towards his private cell. The familiar seamless stone wall greets him, barring passage into his room. Usually it dissolves upon sensing his arrival, but now each heartbeat seems to mark another eternity he must wait. Could they already be on to him? Could already they know?

Hope dilutes his panic as the stone thins to mist forming a door. The distraught mage barrels on through it before it fully disappears. He stumbles in the lightless cell, crashing into the dark glass hung upon the wall. The glass cracks under the force, partially dislodging from its frame. A slip, a fall, a sparkling crackle of myriad shards going their separate ways. A light now glows dimly, drowning in the murky cell.

Ormenos stares blankly at the violet reflections caught in the shattered fragments, tracing in reverse their destructive descent. Those thousands of dark eyes stare skyward, gazing enviously at their other half yet hanging mostly unbroken in its frame - the frame they all once shared. The half remaining attempts to conceal what the missing half reveals...
A weakly pulsating amethyst glares at him; like some dreary, half-opened eye, it stares, scrutinizing, evaluating...
...watching.

Heart pounding, breath desperately chasing after each beat, Ormenos slowly plucks the crystal from its fixture, robbing them of sight. How long have they been monitoring him? How many eyes do they have scattered about?
Why him?
The Enclave is not the refuge he once believed it to be. The ancient demons responsible for the demise of the Thiuda had only started the project anew with the Enclave. That must be it.

But Ormenos refuses to become the thrall of some ancient evil. He will go beyond their sight. He will leave the Enclave, find the Thought Wheel of the Beginning, become an unassailable entity! He will transcend - ascend! - beyond the vicious influence of these primordial malefactors.
Hastily shoving his most precious articles and effects into a travel sack, he makes for the gates of the Enclave and the Forest of Deception they lead to.

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!0..dialogue_text: Steam permeates the air, carrying within the heavy scent of pepper, garlic, and other spices both subtle and overt. The sizzling, glistening meats and pan-fried vegetables open drool's floodgates. A stomach growls loudly. Ormenos'. Had it really been so long since his last meal?

He wipes the thin stream of drool escaping his lips and searches the room for an empty seat - easier to find a specific memory among the Wayfarer's chaotic sea of thoughts. As his eyes scan the room, he notices a Brother resting just outside the kitchen. One of the few magi specializing in something other than Techne - more of an honorary mage, perhaps - this is the man whose back story defies all logic, the man name Cook Ding. He is unique among their Order, for his mind is unlike the others: truly invisible to mindsight. Ones such as him are not found anywhere outside of Kabu - Unseen, they call it there. This added to the fact that his tales strain credulity in an already insane world and the result is a very fragmented picture of his past. A genuine mystery, that one.
Ormenos' survey has revealed no available seats, and so he considers whether to talk to Cook Ding to pass the time, or simply to leave and ignore his stomach's complaints.

B.response_text: Talk to the Cook

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!0..dialogue_text: With a smile and a nod, Cook Ding happily returns to his work. Spotting the newly vacated seat, Ormenos moves to occupy it. An uncontrollable urge to gorge wells up within him as he loads his plate with fine cuts of meat, steamed vegetables and anything he can get his hands on, dousing it all in dozens of sauces.

Ormenos feeds along with all his other nameless, pig brethren. They are all lost in this decadent moment of carnal indulgence. Hand to food, and food to mouth, they perform their rhythmic dance. Juices stream down their jowls as they shovel and chew, shovel and chew. Diminutive Cloudstones busily deliver more dishes and wines for them to quench their voracious appetites.

Bellies fill faster than desire can diminish; stomachs stretch beyond comfort; and a choral flatulence indicates many among them have more than surpassed their natural limits. But even desire soon dissipates when faced with this much excess. It mutates, now spiced with shame and regret, balanced by the knowledge they have all transgressed together - a crime in company is far more palatable than a solitary affair.

Ormenos rises from his seat, ready to depart. He stumbles away from the table, half-comatose, wondering why those of the Order only abandon the path of Discipline when in the Refectory - especially when it is elsewhere enforced with utmost severity. The Phrygian wisemen once said that a string wound too tightly is prone to snapping. An adequate explanation? At any rate, he no longer cares, for the blood from his brain now quietly transfers to his gut in order to better cope with the mess he has created down there...

Steam permeates the air, carrying within the heavy scent of pepper, garlic, and other spices both subtle and overt. The sizzling, glistening meats and pan-fried vegetables open drool's floodgates. A stomach growls loudly. Ormenos'. Had it really been so long since his last meal?

He wipes the thin stream of drool escaping his lips and searches the room for an empty seat - easier to find a specific memory among the Wayfarer's chaotic sea of thoughts. As his eyes scan the room, he notices a Brother resting just outside the kitchen. One of the few magi specializing in something other than Techne - more of an honorary mage, perhaps - this is the man whose back story defies all logic, the man name Cook Ding. He is unique among their Order, for his mind is unlike the others: truly invisible to mindsight. Ones such as him are not found anywhere outside of Kabu - Unseen, they call it there. This added to the fact that his tales strain credulity in an already insane world and the result is a very fragmented picture of his past. A genuine mystery, that one.
Ormenos' survey has revealed no available seats, and so he considers whether to talk to Cook Ding to pass the time, or simply to leave and ignore his stomach's complaints.

B.response_text: Talk to the Cook

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!0..dialogue_text: A contingent of younger acolytes greet Ormenos' sight as they sweep, mop, and otherwise clean the filth left by ravenous magi throughout the day. The mixed scent of oils and spices lingers in the air, bringing a slight welling of drool to Ormenos' mouth.\n\n        Yet, all a hungry mage can do now is sate himself with the memories of delights once tasted; for the feasts are over as night descends upon the Enclave.
"Hullo there, Brother! Yer fixin' fer a meal, ain' ya?"
"Wull, I'd lo'e ta speak with ya, bu' Sister Chiwanle seems ta ha'e jus' finish'd!"
"So go on now! Ya grab tha' sea' o'er there, won' ya!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Biracul's Beard! Yer back then, are ya, Brother Inq'isitor?"

A.response_text: "Indeed, Brother! I was curious about how you joined our Order."

B.response_text: "Why do you speak like that?"

E.response_text: "Shut up and let me go eat."

F.response_text: "Do you want to play the Inquisitor game?"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Ya havin' trouble rembrin'? Yer the one who q'estioned me when I go' here!"

A.response_text: "True, but I could use a refresher."

B.response_text: "I have no recollection of that."

E.response_text: "I ask the questions here!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Wull, I s'pose 'tis 'cause I come frem Kabu!"

A.response_text: "Why did you end up coming to the Enclave?"

B.response_text: "But, other magi from Kabu don't share your 'singular' speech..."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Alrigh' then, ya enjoy yer meal, Brother!"
"Thanks fer the kind words, Brother Inq'isitor!"

D.response_text: "Not the sharpest knife in the kitchen, are we?"

E.response_text: "I was mocking you, lack-wit!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "The Inq'isitor game? Wha' ya be talkin' abou' there, Brother Inq'istor?!"
"Wull, alrigh'! Lemme star' frem the beginnin' then!"
"Ya see, the Shinin' One works in mysterious ways, so ma tale begins in Kabu with a punishmen' fer a crime I didn' e'en do!"
"Ma mind was changed ta the Unseen mind! And inta the was'es they exil'd me!"
"Bu' see, the thin' is I go' pushed inta the blackness of the Pi', tha' I did, where the draugs sough' ta suck ou' ma Trueflesh!"

E.response_text: "Enough! I've heard enough!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Biracul, then came ta me in visi'n!"
"He said ta me, he said..."
"'RUN, YA JINN-CURSED FOOL!'"

E.response_text: "Okay, just shut up! Please!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "So, I ran!"
"Bu' the thin' is tha' I... ya see, I..."
"Wull, ya see, I los' ma way! So much easier when ya go' the Moon Tower to guide ya..."

E.response_text: "I can't take it anymore! Stop talking!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Bu' in any case, I walk'd some, down ta some sal' fla's."
"Then rode with a caravan, thems sold me as a sla'e ta a Jeran ship cap'n down in Zemes, bu' tha' cap'n, he done died frem the muddy breeches illness, ya see."
"So, I go' off tha' ship in Jer, where some looney jinnworshippers caugh' me and took me to see a... a Wyrm, they call'd i'!"
"Bu' 'twas abou' as real as the Sylvan Architec', I suspec'! 'Cause I jus' lied there in tha' weird room awai'in' fer somethin', bu' nothin' happen'd!"
"So, I star'd yellin' fer someone ta come ge' me."

E.response_text: "Yes, someone take this idiot away!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "And they came, lookin' like they'd done seen seen ol' Famlaz himself!"
"Told me I was chosen by their Lady or somethin' and se' me free."
"Bu' I didn' know where ta go..."

E.response_text: "Anywhere! Just shut up and go away!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "So I walk'd through a fores' and came upon a lovely buildin'."
"And ou' o' nowhere! BAM! Someone bops me on the noggin!"
"Nex' thin' I know, I woke up in yer q'estinin' room, where ya ask'd me all sor' a odd q'estins."

E.response_text: "Are you finally done babbling, you lack-wit?"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Tha' refresh yer mem'ry, Brother?"
"Oh! Bu' 'tis no' the sharpness o' the knife tha' makes the slicin' smooth!"

D.response_text: "Please enlighten me, oh wise Cook Ding!"

E.response_text: "I've heard enough of your lack-wit ramblings!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Ya see, this here knife been with me since I was firs' pu' in the ki'chen ta work!"
"Ne'er did ha'e need ta sharpen i' again!"
"There's a reason fer i', I tell ya."
"Ya see, when I slice through them Suyu'i goa's ya be grubbin' on, I don' hack a' the bone like them other cooks."
"Me, wull, I slice through the tendons and sinew, through them spaces 'tween the bones!"
"Obstacles ain' obstacles a' all when ya don' le' 'em ge' in yer way! Ain' tha' the truth!"

A.response_text: "Look, Brother, I apologize for my sarcasm earlier."

B.response_text: "Wait... what are 'Suyuti' goats?"

C.response_text: "Sure thing, but hey, maybe I should go eat..."

D.response_text: "There is indeed, some wisdom in your words; I'll remember them."

E.response_text: "I wish someone would take a knife to your throat."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Don' ya pay i' no mind, Brother Inq'isitor!"
"Wull, I'll be a son o' a Jinn! Impress'd the Senior Though'-Wea'er himself, did I!"
"I'm jus' abou' as happy as a Suyu'i with a new goa'! Thank ya, Brother!"
"Oh, wull, ya see, back where I was bern, there was a creature e'en ta foul fer the slums!"
"We tried to trea' him kind and such by gi'ing him free food, 'cause he was too draug-brained ta e'en clean the sewers, ya know?"
"Bu' tha' basterd would try ta score our gif's ta him and demand more fer him ta raise the jinncursed score!"
"He was one brain shor' o' bein' a half-wi', if ya ask me!"
"Soon enough, he was caugh' tryin' ta do unq'esti'nable thin's with the li'estock and go' exil'd inta the was'es."
"Bu' enough abou' the goa' fella'er! Ge'cha on down ta a sea' and star' grubbin', Brother!"
"...Ooooh! I ge' i'! Yer the Inq'isitor, so ya be the one askin' the q'esti'ns! Tha's a good one, Brother!"

F.response_text: "Yes... NOW TELL ME WHERE YOU'RE HIDING IT!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Wull, in the lower le'els o' Dazir we all speak like this."
"When yer bern in the slums, ya don' ge' the same learnin' o' the upper tiers... In fac', we don' end up talkin' much ta them neither."
"So, i' stands ta reason our way o' speakin' would be differen' in the sligh'es'."
"Bu' enough on tha'! I should ge' back ta slicin' and ya should ge' ta grubbin'!"
"Hidin' wha', Brother?!"

F.response_text: "DON'T PLAY COY! THE FORBIDDEN TOME: THE LLAMA SUTRA!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Oh... Tha'... Wull, I'm under oath ta keep i' frem others eyes!"

F.response_text: "...Wait, what?! You actually have a tome called the Llama Sutra?!"

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Indeed... i's a pic'ure tome I made with yer mother las' nigh'!"

F.response_text: "...I played with fire; and I got burned."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "Aye! The flames o' the ki'chen be ablazin'!"

F.response_text: "Oh? But remember: revenge is a dish best served cold..."

ENCLAVE!HALLS OF THE ADEPTI!REFECTORY!1..dialogue_text: "AHAHAHA! Tha' I'll be rembrin' ma Brother; tha' I'll be rembrin'!"
